author: gcolvin
content: "Rough consensus and running code."  Unlike the blockchain, human consensus doesn't have to be 100%.  It's best when it is, but most people can go along with decisions they disagree with when necessary.  What's really bad is when a developer or team is so much in disagreement they would prefer to leave.  Everyone would need to be very sure of their position to let that happen.  So far it hasn't.
